title: Claude 3.5 Sonnet with Artifacts - Game Changing Feature
tldr: Claude 3.5 Sonnet introduces Artifacts - a revolutionary feature that lets you create interactive demos, code examples, and mini-apps directly in chat. Perfect for rapid prototyping and client presentations.
why: This fundamentally changes how we prototype and iterate on ideas. Instead of switching between tools, you can build and test concepts instantly.
apply_steps: Start with simple React components or data visualizations
Use for client presentations and rapid mockups
Integrate into your design workflow for faster iteration

title: Cursor IDE + GitHub Copilot: The Future of AI-Assisted Development
tldr: Cursor IDE with GitHub Copilot provides unprecedented AI-assisted development. Real-time code completion, architecture suggestions, and 60-80% faster feature development.
why: The AI-first coding approach is becoming the new standard. Early adopters report massive productivity gains.
apply_steps: Replace your current IDE with Cursor
Use Claude for code reviews and architectural planning

title: Next.js 15 App Router Performance Optimizations
tldr: Next.js 15 introduces major App Router optimizations: 40% faster builds, improved caching, and enhanced Partial Prerendering for AI applications.
why: Performance improvements directly impact user experience and SEO, especially critical for AI-heavy applications.
apply_steps: Upgrade to Next.js 15 in a test environment
Enable Partial Prerendering for dynamic AI content

title: Building Production RAG Systems with LangChain
tldr: Comprehensive guide to production RAG systems. Covers vector stores, chunking strategies, evaluation metrics, and deployment patterns for enterprise applications.
why: RAG is becoming essential for AI applications. This provides battle-tested patterns for production deployment.

title: STAR Method for Prompt Engineering Excellence
tldr: STAR framework (Situation, Task, Action, Result) dramatically improves AI responses. 40% better results confirmed across multiple use cases.
why: Most developers use vague prompts. STAR provides a structured approach for consistent, high-quality AI outputs.
apply_steps: Apply STAR to your next 5 AI interactions
Template: 'I am [situation], I need to [task], I will use [action], I expect [result]'
Create team prompt templates using STAR
